instruction: Prepare the vegetables: Chop garlic and ginger finely. Slice carrots into thin strips. Cut broccoli into florets. Slice bell pepper into thin strips. Trim and cut snow peas in half.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, cornstarch, and water until smooth.
Heat olive oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger to the hot wok and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add carrots and broccoli to the wok and stir-fry for 2 minutes until slightly tender.
Add bell pepper and snow peas to the wok and stir-fry for 1 minute until crisp-tender.
Push vegetables to the side of the wok and add the sauce to the empty center. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
Pour the sauce over the vegetables and toss to coat evenly.
Stir in sesame oil and cook for 30 seconds more.
Serve immediately over rice or noodles.
